00030 
00031 // top - relations between each pair of variables are unknown or too complex to be representable as affine inequalities (minimal information)
00032 // intermediate - some concrete information is known about some variable pairs
00033 // bottom - impossible situation (maximal information) (bottom flag = true)
00034 
00035 // By default the constraint graph is = top. Since this implies a top inequality between every pair, we don't 
00036 // actually maintain such affineInequality objects. Instead, if there is no affineInequality between a pair of
00037 // variables, this itself implies that this affineInequality=top.
00038 class ConstrGraph : public virtual InfiniteLattice, public dottable//, public virtual LogicalCond
00039 {
00040 public:
00041         // Possible levels of this constraint graph, defined by their information content in ascending order.
00042         typedef enum levels {
00043                 // Uninitialized constraint graph. Uninitialized constraint graphs behave
00044                 //    just like regular constraint graphs but they are not equal to any other graph
00045                 //    until they are initialized. Any operation that modifies or reads the state  
00046                 //    of a constraint graph (not including comparisons or other operations that don't
00047                 //    access individual variable mappings) causes it to become initialized (if it 
00048                 //    wasn't already). An uninitialized constraint graph is !=bottom. 
00049                 //    printing a graph's contents does not make it initialized.
00050                 uninitialized = 0,
00051                 // Constraint graph that has no constraints
00052                 bottom,
00053                 // This graph's constraints are defined as a conjunction or disjunction of inequalities.
00054                 // More details are provided in constrType field
00055                 constrKnown,
00056                 // The set of constraints in this graph are too complex to be described as a conjunction of inequalities or
00057                 // a negation of such a conjunction 
00058                 top};
00059 protected:
00060         levels level;
00061         
00062 public:
00063         typedef enum {
00064                 unknown,
00065                 // This graph's constraints are represented as a conjunction of inequalities.
00066                 conj,
00067                 // Constraints are representes as the negation of a conjunction of inequalities. 
00068                 // This is the same as a disjunction of the negations of the same inequalities.
00069                 negConj,
00070                 // This graph's constrants are mutually-inconsistent
00071                 inconsistent
00072         } constrTypes;
00073 protected:
00074         constrTypes constrType;
00075         
00076         // The function and DataflowNode that this constraint graph corresponds to
00077         // as well as the node's state
00078         const Function& func;
00079         //const DataflowNode& n;
00080         const NodeState& state;
00081         
00082         // Represents constrants (x<=y+c). vars2Value[x] maps to a set of constraint::<y, a, b, c>
00083         //std::map<varID, std::map<varID, constraint> > vars2Value;
00084         std::map<varID, std::map<varID, affineInequality> > vars2Value;
00085         
00086         // The LiveDeadVarsAnalysis that identifies the live/dead state of all application variables.
00087         // Needed to create a FiniteVarsExprsProductLattice.
00088         LiveDeadVarsAnalysis* ldva;
00089                 
00090         // To allow the user to modify the graph in several spots before calling isSelfConsistent()
00091         // we allow them to perform their modifications inside a transaction and call isSelfConsistent only
00092         // at the end of the transaction
00093         bool inTransaction;
00094         
00095         // The divisibility lattices associated with the current CFG node
00096         // divL is a map from annotations to product lattices. Each product lattice will only be used to
00097         //    reason about variables that have the same annotation. When a variable has multiple annotations
00098         //    only one matching product lattice will be used.
00099         // The annotation ""->NULL matches all variables
00100         std::map<std::pair<std::string, void*>, FiniteVarsExprsProductLattice*> divL;
00101         
00102         // The sign lattices associated with the current CFG node
00103         // sgnL is a map from annotations to product lattices. Each product lattice will only be used to
00104         //   reason about variables that have the same annotation. When a variable has multiple annotations
00105         //   only one matching product lattice will be used.
00106         // The annotation ""->NULL matches all variables
00107         // GB : 2011-03-05 (Removing Sign Lattice Dependence) std::map<std::pair<std::string, void*>, FiniteVarsExprsProductLattice*> sgnL;
00108         
00109         // Set of live variables that this constraint graph applies to
00110         std::set<varID> vars;
00111         
00112         // set of variables for which we have divisibility information
00113         // noDivVars std::set<varID> divVars;
00114         
00115         // Flag indicating whether some of the constraints have changed since the last time
00116         // this graph was checked for bottom-ness
00117         bool constrChanged;
00118         // Set of variables the for which we've added constraints since the last transitive closure
00119         /* GB 2011-06-02 : newConstrVars->modifiedVars : set<varID> newConstrVars; */
00120         // Set of variables the constraints on which have been modified since the last transitive closure
00121         std::set<varID> modifiedVars;

00124         /**** Constructors & Destructors ****/
00125         public:
00126         // DataflowNode Descriptor object that summarizes the key info about a DataflowNode
00127         // in case this ConstrGraph must represent the state of multiple nodes
00128         class NodeDesc {
00129                 public:
00130                 const DataflowNode& n;
00131                 const NodeState& state;
00132                 std::string annotName;
00133                 void* annotVal;
00134                 std::set<varID> varsToInclude; // Set of variables that must be included in the ConstrGraph that describes this node, even if they are not live
00135                 NodeDesc(const DataflowNode& n, const NodeState& state, std::string annotName, void* annotVal, const std::set<varID>& varsToInclude) : 
00136                         n(n), state(state), annotName(annotName), annotVal(annotVal), varsToInclude(varsToInclude) {}
00137                 NodeDesc(const DataflowNode& n, const NodeState& state, std::string annotName, void* annotVal) : 
00138                         n(n), state(state), annotName(annotName), annotVal(annotVal) {}
00139                 NodeDesc(const DataflowNode& n, const NodeState& state) : 
00140                         n(n), state(state), annotName(""), annotVal(NULL) {}
00141                 bool operator==(const NodeDesc& that) const { return n==that.n && &state==&(that.state) && annotName==that.annotName && annotVal==that.annotVal && varsToInclude==that.varsToInclude; }
00142                 bool operator<(const NodeDesc& that) const { 
00143                         return (n<that.n) ||
00144                                (n==that.n && &state< &(that.state)) || 
00145                                (n==that.n && &state==&(that.state) && annotName<that.annotName) ||
00146                                (n==that.n && &state==&(that.state) && annotName==that.annotName && annotVal<that.annotVal) ||
00147                                (n==that.n && &state==&(that.state) && annotName==that.annotName && annotVal==that.annotVal && varsToInclude<that.varsToInclude);
00148                 }
00149         };

00314         protected:
00315         // Used by copyAnnotVars() and mergeAnnotVars() to identify variables that are interesting
00316         // from their perspective.
00317         bool annotInterestingVar(const varID& var, const std::set<std::pair<std::string, void*> >& noCopyAnnots, const std::set<varID>& noCopyVars,
00318                             const std::string& annotName, void* annotVal, std::string indent="");
00319         
00320         public: 
00321         // Copies the constrains on all the variables that have the given annotation (srcAnnotName -> srcAnnotVal).
00322         // For each such variable we create a copy variable that is identical except that the
00323         //    (srcAnnotName -> srcAnnotVal) annotation is replaced with the (tgtAnnotName -> tgtAnnotVal) annotation.
00324         // If two variables match the (srcAnnotName -> srcAnnotVal) annotation and the constraint graph has a relation
00325         //    between them, their copies will have the same relation between each other but will have no relation to the
00326         //    original variables. If two variables have a relation and only one is copied, then the copy maintains the 
00327         //    original relation to the non-copied variable.
00328         // A variable matches the given (srcAnnotName -> srcAnnotVal) annotation if this is one of the variable's annotations
00329         //    or if srcAnnotName=="" and the variable has no annotations.
00330         // Avoids copying variables with annotations in the noCopyAnnots set and variables in the noCopyVars set.
00331         // Returns true if this causes the constraint graph to change and false otherwise.
00332         bool copyAnnotVars(std::string srcAnnotName, void* srcAnnotVal, 
00333                            std::string tgtAnnotName, void* tgtAnnotVal,
00334                            const std::set<std::pair<std::string, void*> >& noCopyAnnots,
00335                            const std::set<varID>& noCopyVars, std::string indent="");
00336         
00337         // Merges the state of the variables in the constraint graph with the [finalAnnotName -> finalAnnotVal] annotation
00338         //    with the state of the variables with the [remAnnotName -> remAnnotVal]. Each constraint that involves a variable
00339         //    with the former annotation and the same variable with the latter annotation is replaced with the union of the 
00340         //    two constraints and will only involve the variable with the [finalAnnotName -> finalAnnotVal] (latter) annotation.
00341         // All variables with the [remAnnotName -> remAnnotVal] annotation are removed from the constraint graph.
00342         // A variable matches the given (srcAnnotName -> srcAnnotVal) annotation if this is one of the variable's annotations
00343         //    or if srcAnnotName=="" and the variable has no annotations.
00344         // Avoids merging variables with annotations in the noCopyAnnots set and variables in the noCopyVars set.
00345         // Returns true if this causes the constraint graph to change and false otherwise.
00346         // It is assumed that variables that match [finalAnnotName -> finalAnnotVal] differ from variables that match
00347         //    [remAnnotName -> remAnnotVal] in only that annotation.
00348         bool mergeAnnotVars(const std::string& finalAnnotName, void* finalAnnotVal, 
00349                             const std::string& remAnnotName,   void* remAnnotVal,
00350                             const std::set<std::pair<std::string, void*> >& noCopyAnnots,
00351                             const std::set<varID>& noCopyVars, std::string indent="");
00352         
00353         
00354         protected:
00355         // Union the current inequality for y in the given subMap of vars2Value with the given affine inequality
00356         // Returns true if this causes a change in the subMap, false otherwise.
00357         bool unionXYsubMap(std::map<varID, affineInequality>& subMap, const varID& y, const affineInequality& ineq, std::string indent="");
00358         
00359         // Merges the given sub-map of var2Vals, just like mergeAnnotVars. Specifically, for every variable in the subMap
00360         // that has a [remAnnotName -> remAnnotVal] annotation,
00361         // If there exists a corresponding variable that has the [finalAnnotName -> finalAnnotVal] annotation, 
00362         //    their respective inequalities are unioned. This union is left with the latter variable and the former
00363         //    variable's entry in subMap is removed
00364         // If one does not exist, we simply replace the variable's record with an identical one that now belongs
00365         //    to its counterpart with the [finalAnnotName -> finalAnnotVal] annotation.
00366         // Other entries are left alone.
00367         // Returns true if this causes the subMap to change, false otherwise.
00368         bool mergeAnnotVarsSubMap(std::map<varID, affineInequality>& subMap, 
00369                                   std::string finalAnnotName, void* finalAnnotVal, 
00370                                   std::string remAnnotName,   void* remAnnotVal,
00371                                   const std::set<std::pair<std::string, void*> >& noCopyAnnots,
00372                                   const std::set<varID>& noCopyVars, std::string indent="");
00373         
00374         // Support routine for mergeAnnotVars(). Filters out any rem variables in the given set, replacing
00375         // them with their corresponding final versions if those final versions are not already in the set
00376         // Returns true if this causes the set to change, false otherwise.
00377         bool mergeAnnotVarsSet(std::set<varID> varsSet, 
00378                                std::string finalAnnotName, void* finalAnnotVal, 
00379                                std::string remAnnotName,   void* remAnnotVal,
00380                                const std::set<std::pair<std::string, void*> >& noCopyAnnots,
00381                                const std::set<varID>& noCopyVars, std::string indent="");

00384                             
00385         // Returns true if the given variable has an annotation in the given set and false otherwise.
00386         // The variable matches an annotation if its name and value directly match or if the variable
00387         // has no annotations and the annotation's name is "".
00388         static bool varHasAnnot(const varID& var, const std::set<std::pair<std::string, void*> >& annots, std::string indent="");
00389         
00390         // Returns true if the given variable has an annotation in the given set and false otherwise.
00391         // The variable matches an annotation if its name and value directly match or if the variable
00392         // has no annotations and the annotName=="".
00393         static bool varHasAnnot(const varID& var, std::string annotName, void* annotVal, std::string indent="");
00394         
00395         // Called by analyses to create a copy of this lattice. However, if this lattice maintains any 
00396         //    information on a per-variable basis, these per-variable mappings must be converted from 
00397         //    the current set of variables to another set. This may be needed during function calls, 
00398         //    when dataflow information from the caller/callee needs to be transferred to the callee/calleer.
00399         // We do not force child classes to define their own versions of this function since not all
00400         //    Lattices have per-variable information.
00401         // varNameMap - maps all variable names that have changed, in each mapping pair, pair->first is the 
00402         //              old variable and pair->second is the new variable
00403         // func - the function that the copy Lattice will now be associated with
00404         void remapVars(const std::map<varID, varID>& varNameMap, const Function& newFunc) {} 
00405         
00406         // Called by analyses to copy over from the that Lattice dataflow information into this Lattice.
00407         // that contains data for a set of variables and incorporateVars must overwrite the state of just
00408         // those variables, while leaving its state for other variables alone.
00409         // We do not force child classes to define their own versions of this function since not all
00410         //    Lattices have per-variable information.
00411         void incorporateVars(Lattice* that) {}
00412         
00413         // Returns a Lattice that describes the information known within this lattice
00414         // about the given expression. By default this could be the entire lattice or any portion of it.
00415         // For example, a lattice that maintains lattices for different known variables and expression will 
00416         // return a lattice for the given expression. Similarly, a lattice that keeps track of constraints
00417         // on values of variables and expressions will return the portion of the lattice that relates to
00418         // the given expression. 
00419         // It it legal for this function to return NULL if no information is available.
00420         // The function's caller is responsible for deallocating the returned object
00421         Lattice* project(SgExpression* expr) { return copy(); }
00422         
00423         // The inverse of project(). The call is provided with an expression and a Lattice that describes
00424         // the dataflow state that relates to expression. This Lattice must be of the same type as the lattice
00425         // returned by project(). unProject() must incorporate this dataflow state into the overall state it holds.
00426         // Call must make an internal copy of the passed-in lattice and the caller is responsible for deallocating it.
00427         // Returns true if this causes this to change and false otherwise.
00428         bool unProject(SgExpression* expr, Lattice* exprState) { return meetUpdate(exprState, "    "); }
00429         
00430         // Returns a constraint graph that only includes the constrains in this constraint graph that involve the
00431         // variables in focusVars and their respective divisibility variables, if any. 
00432         // It is assumed that focusVars only contains scalars and not array ranges.
00433         ConstrGraph* getProjection(const varIDSet& focusVars, std::string indent="");
00434         
00435         // Creates a new constraint graph that is the disjoint union of the two given constraint graphs.
00436         // The variables in cg1 and cg2 that are not in the noAnnot set, are annotated with cg1Annot and cg2Annot, respectively,
00437         // under the name annotName.
00438         // cg1 and cg2 are assumed to have identical constraints between variables in the noAnnotset.
00439         static ConstrGraph* joinCG(ConstrGraph* cg1, void* cg1Annot, ConstrGraph* cg2, void* cg2Annot, 
00440                                    std::string annotName, const varIDSet& noAnnot, std::string indent="");
00441         
00442         protected:
00443         // Copies the per-variable contents of srcCG to tgtCG, while ensuring that in tgtCG all variables that are not
00444         // in noAnnot are annotated with the annotName->annot label. For variables in noAnnot, the function ensures
00445         // that tgtCG does not have inconsistent mappings between such variables.
00446         static void joinCG_copyState(ConstrGraph* tgtCG, ConstrGraph* srcCG, void* annot, 
00447                                      std::string annotName, const varIDSet& noAnnot, std::string indent="");
00448         
00449         public:
00450         // Replaces all references to variables with the given annotName->annot annotation to 
00451         // references to variables without the annotation
00452         // Returns true if this causes the constraint graph to change and false otherwise
00453         bool removeVarAnnot(std::string annotName, void* annot, std::string indent="");
00454         
00455         // Replaces all references to variables with the given annotName->annot annotation to 
00456         // references to variables without the annotation
00457         // Returns true if this causes the constraint graph to change and false otherwise
00458         bool replaceVarAnnot(std::string oldAnnotName, void* oldAnnot,
00459                              std::string newAnnotName, void* newAnnot, std::string indent="");
00460         
00461         // For all variables that have a string (tgtAnnotName -> tgtAnnotVal) annotation 
00462         //    (or if tgtAnnotName=="" and the variable has no annotation), add the annotation
00463         //    (newAnnotName -> newAnnotVal).

00498         // Add the condition (x*a <= y*b + c) to this constraint graph. The addition is done via a conjunction operator, 
00499         // meaning that the resulting graph will be left with either (x*a <= y*b + c) or the original condition, whichever is stronger.
00500         // returns true if this causes the constraint graph to change and false otherwise
00501         bool assertCond(const varAffineInequality& cond, std::string indent="");
00502         
00503         // add the condition (x*a <= y*b + c) to this constraint graph
00504         // returns true if this causes the constraint graph to change and false otherwise
00505         bool assertCond(const varID& x, const varID& y, const affineInequality& ineq, std::string indent="");
00506

00508         // returns true if this causes the constraint graph to change and false otherwise
00509         bool assertCond(const varID& x, const varID& y, int a, int b, int c, std::string indent="");
00510         
00511         // add the condition (x*a = y*b + c) to this constraint graph
00512         // returns true if this causes the constraint graph to change and false otherwise
00513         bool assertEq(const varAffineInequality& cond, std::string indent="");
00514         bool assertEq(varID x, varID y, const affineInequality& ineq, std::string indent="");

00528         { return eqVars(v1, v2, 1, 1, 0, indent); }

00531         // Otherwise, returns false.

00533

00540

00542         bool ltVars(const varID& v1, const varID& v2, int a=1, int b=1, int c=0, std::string indent="");

00544         // Class used to iterate over all the constraints x*a <= y*b + c for a given variable x
00545         class leIterator
00546         {

00548                 const ConstrGraph* parent;
00549                 std::map<varID, std::map<varID, affineInequality> >::const_iterator curX;
00550                 std::map<varID, affineInequality>::const_iterator curY;
00551

00554                            const std::map<varID, std::map<varID, affineInequality> >::iterator& curX);
00555                         
00556                 leIterator(const ConstrGraph* parent,
00557                            const varID& x);
00558                 
00559                 bool isDone() const;
00560

00562                 
00563                 void operator ++ ();
00564                 void operator ++ (int);
00565                 
00566                 bool operator==(const leIterator& otherIt) const;
00567                 bool operator!=(const leIterator& otherIt) const;
00568         };
00569         // Beginning and end points of the iteration over all constraints x*a <= y*b + c for a 
00570         // given variable x.
00571         leIterator leBegin(const varID& y);
00572         leIterator leEnd();
00573         
00574         // Class used to iterate over all the constraints x*a <= y*b + c for a given variable y
00575         class geIterator
00576         {
00577                 bool isEnd; // true if this is the end iterator
00578                 std::map<varID, std::map<varID, affineInequality> >::const_iterator curX;
00579                 std::map<varID, affineInequality>::const_iterator curY;
00580                 const ConstrGraph* parent;
00581                 const varID y;
00582                 
00583                 public:
00584                 geIterator();
00585                 
00586                 geIterator(const ConstrGraph* parent, const varID& y);
00587                 
00588                 geIterator(const ConstrGraph* parent, const varID& y,
00589                            const std::map<varID, std::map<varID, affineInequality> >::iterator& curX,
00590                            const std::map<varID, affineInequality>::iterator& curY);
00591                 
00592                 // Advances curX and curY by one step. Returns false if curX/curY is already at the
00593                 // end of parent.vars2Value and true otherwise (i.e. successful step).
00594                 bool step();
00595                 
00596                 // Move curX/curY to the next x/y pair with a matching y (may leave curX/curY already satisfy this).
00597                 // Returns true if there are no more such pairs.
00598                 bool advance();
00599                 
00600                 bool isDone() const;
00601                 
00602                 const varID& getX() const;
00603                 
00604                 varAffineInequality operator*() const ;
00605                 
00606                 void operator ++ ();
00607                 void operator ++ (int);
00608                 
00609                 bool operator==(const geIterator& otherIt) const;
00610                 bool operator!=(const geIterator& otherIt) const;
00611         };
00612         // Beginning and End points of the iteration over all constraints x*a <= y*b + c for a 
00613         // given variable y.
00614         geIterator geBegin(const varID& y);
00615         geIterator geEnd();

00617         // widens this from that and saves the result in this
00618         // returns true if this causes this to change and false otherwise
00619         bool widenUpdate(InfiniteLattice* that, std::string indent="");
00620         bool widenUpdate(InfiniteLattice* that) { return widenUpdate(that, ""); }
00621         
00622         // Widens this from that and saves the result in this, while ensuring that if a given constraint
00623         // doesn't exist in that, its counterpart in this is not modified
00624         // returns true if this causes this to change and false otherwise
00625         bool widenUpdateLimitToThat(InfiniteLattice* that, std::string indent="");
00626         
00627         // Common code for widenUpdate() and widenUpdateLimitToThat()
00628         bool widenUpdate_ex(InfiniteLattice* that_arg, bool limitToThat, std::string indent="");
00629         
00630         // computes the meet of this and that and saves the result in this
00631         // returns true if this causes this to change and false otherwise
00632         // The meet is the intersection of constraints: the set of constraints 
00633         //    that is common to both constraint graphs. Thus, the result is the loosest
00634         //    set of constraints that satisfies both sets and therefore also the information union.
00635         bool meetUpdate(Lattice* that, std::string indent="");
00636         bool meetUpdate(Lattice* that) { return meetUpdate(that, ""); }
00637         
00638         // Meet this and that and saves the result in this, while ensuring that if a given constraint
00639         // doesn't exist in that, its counterpart in this is not modified
00640         // returns true if this causes this to change and false otherwise
00641         bool meetUpdateLimitToThat(InfiniteLattice* that, std::string indent="");
00642                 
00643         // Common code for meetUpdate() and meetUpdateLimitToThat()
00644         bool meetUpdate_ex(Lattice* that_arg, bool limitToThat, std::string indent="");
00645         
00646         // <from LogicalCond>
00647         bool orUpd(LogicalCond& that, std::string indent="");
00648         bool orUpd(LogicalCond& that)
00649         { return orUpd(that, ""); }
00650 
00651         // <from LogicalCond>
00652         bool andUpd(LogicalCond& that, std::string indent="");
00653         bool andUpd(LogicalCond& that)
00654         { return andUpd(that, ""); }

00656         bool andUpd(ConstrGraph* that, std::string indent="");
00657         bool andUpd(ConstrGraph* that)
00658         { return andUpd(that, ""); }
00659         
00660         // Unified function for Or(meet), And and Widening
00661         // If meet == true, this function computes the meet and if =false, computes the widening.
00662         // If OR == true, the function computes the OR of each pair of inequalities and otherwise, computes the AND.
00663         // if limitToThat == true, if a given constraint does not exist in that, this has no effect on the meet/widening
00664         bool OrAndWidenUpdate(ConstrGraph* that, bool meet, bool OR, bool limitToThat, std::string indent="");
00665 
00666         
00667         // Portion of OrAndWidenUpdate that deals with x variables for which there exist x->y mapping 
00668         // in This but not in That. Increments itThisX and updates modified and modifiedVars in case this 
00669         // function modifies the constraint graph.
00670         void OrAndWidenUpdate_XinThisNotThat(
00671                                             bool OR, bool limitToThat, 
00672                                             std::map<varID, std::map<varID, affineInequality> >::iterator& itThisX, bool& modified,
00673                                             std::string indent="");
00674         
00675         // Portion of OrAndWidenUpdate that deals with x variables for which there exist x->y mapping 
00676         // in That but not in This. Increments itThisX and updates modified and modifiedVars in case this 
00677         // function modifies the constraint graph.
00678         // additionsToThis - Records the new additions to vars2Value that need to be made after we are done iterating 
00679         //      over it. It guaranteed that the keys mapped by the first level of additionsToThis are not mapped
00680         //      at the first level by vals2Value.
00681         void OrAndWidenUpdate_XinThatNotThis(
00682                                             bool OR, bool limitToThat, 
00683                                             ConstrGraph* that,
00684                                             std::map<varID, std::map<varID, affineInequality> >::iterator& itThatX, 
00685                                             std::map<varID, std::map<varID, affineInequality> >& additionsToThis, 
00686                                             bool& modified, std::string indent="");
00687         
00688         // Portion of OrAndWidenUpdate that deals with x->y pairs for which there exist x->y mapping 
00689         // in This but not in That. Increments itThisX and updates modified and modifiedVars in case this 
00690         // function modifies the constraint graph.
00691         void OrAndWidenUpdate_YinThisNotThat(
00692                                             bool OR, bool limitToThat, 
00693                                             std::map<varID, std::map<varID, affineInequality> >::iterator& itThisX,
00694                                             std::map<varID, affineInequality>::iterator& itThisY, 
00695                                             bool& modified, std::string indent="");
00696         
00697         // Portion of OrAndWidenUpdate that deals with x->y pairs for which there exist x->y mapping 
00698         // in That but not in This. Increments itThisX and updates modified and modifiedVars in case this 
00699         // function modifies the constraint graph.
00700         // additionsToThis - Records the new additions to vars2Value[itThisX->first] that need to be made after 
00701         //      we are done iterating over it. It guaranteed that the keys mapped by additionsToThis are not mapped
00702         //      at the first level by vals2Value[itThisX->first].
00703         void OrAndWidenUpdate_YinThatNotThis(
00704                                             bool OR, bool limitToThat,

00707                                             std::map<varID, affineInequality>& additionsToThis, 
00708                                             bool& modified, std::string indent="");
00709                 
00710         // Computes the transitive closure of the given constraint graph, and updates the graph to be that transitive closure. 
00711         // Returns true if this causes the graph to change and false otherwise.
00712         bool transitiveClosure(std::string indent="");
00713         protected:

00718         public:
00719         // Computes the transitive closure of the given constraint graph,
00720         // focusing on the constraints of scalars that have divisibility variables
00721         // we only bother propagating constraints to each such variable through its divisibility variable
00722         // Returns true if this causes the graph to change and false otherwise.
00723         // noDivVars bool divVarsClosure(std::string indent="");
00724         
00725         // The portion of divVarsClosure that is called for every y variable. Thus, given x and x' (x's divisibility variable)
00726         // divVarsClosure_perY() is called for every scalar or array y to infer the x->y connection thru x->x'->y and
00727         // infer the y->x connection thru x->x'->x
00728         // Returns true if this causes the graph to change and false otherwise.
00729         // noDivVars bool divVarsClosure_perY(const varID& x, const varID& divX, const varID& y, 
00730         // noDivVars                          affineInequality* constrXDivX, affineInequality* constrDivXX/*,
00731         // noDivVars                          affineInequality::signs xSign, affineInequality::signs ySign*/,
00732         // noDivVars                          std::string indent="");
00733         
00734         // Computes the transitive closure of this constraint graph while modifying 
00735         // only the constraints that involve the given variable
00736         // Returns true if this causes the graph to change and false otherwise.
00737         bool localTransClosure(const varID& tgtVar, std::string indent="");
00738                 
00739 protected:
00740         // Searches this constraint graph for negative cycles, which indicates that the constraints represented
00741         //    by the graph are not self-consistent (the code region where the graph holds is unreachable). Modifies
00742         //    the level of this graph as needed.
00743         // Returns true if this call caused a modification in the graph and false otherwise.
00744         bool checkSelfConsistency(std::string indent="");
00745         
00746 public:
00747         
00748         // Creates a divisibility variable for the given variable and adds it to the constraint graph
00749         // If var = r (mod d), then the relationship between x and x' (the divisibility variable)
00750         // will be x = x'*d + r
00751         // returns true if this causes the constraint graph to be modified (it may not if this 
00752         //    information is already in the graph) and false otherwise
00753         // noDivVars bool addDivVar(varID var/*, int div, int rem*/, bool killDivVar=false, std::string indent="");
00754         
00755         // Disconnect this variable from all other variables except its divisibility variable. This is done 
00756         // in order to compute the original variable's relationships while taking its divisibility information 
00757         // into account.
00758         // Returns true if this causes the constraint graph to be modified and false otherwise
00759         // noDivVars bool disconnectDivOrigVar(varID var/*, int div, int rem*/, std::string indent="");
00760         
00761         // Finds the variable within this constraint graph that corresponds to the given divisibility variable.
00762         //    If such a variable exists, returns the pair <variable, true>.
00763         //    Otherwise, returns <???, false>.
00764         // noDivVars std::pair<varID, bool> divVar2Var(const varID& divVar, std::string indent="");

00798         
00799         // Sets the state of this constraint graph to Uninitialized, without modifying its contents. Thus, 
00800         //    the graph will register as uninitalized but when it is next used, its state will already be set up.
00801         // Returns true if this causes the constraint graph to be modified and false otherwise.
00802         bool setToUninitialized_KeepState(std::string indent="");
00803         
00804         // Sets the state of this constraint graph to Bottom
00805         // Returns true if this causes the constraint graph to be modified and false otherwise.
00806         bool setToBottom(std::string indent="");
00807         
00808         // Sets the state of this constraint graph to constrKnown, with the given constraintType
00809         // eraseCurConstr - if true, erases the current set of constraints and if false, leaves them alone
00810         // Returns true if this causes the constraint graph to be modified and false otherwise.
00811         bool setToConstrKnown(constrTypes ct, bool eraseCurConstr=true, std::string indent="");
00812         
00813         // Sets the state of this constraint graph to Inconsistent
00814         // noConsistencyCheck - flag indicating whether this function should do nothing if this noConsistencyCheck() returns 
00815         //              true (=false) or to not bother checking with isBottom (=true)
00816         // Returns true if this causes the constraint graph to be modified and false otherwise.
00817         bool setToInconsistent(std::string indent="");
00818         
00819         // Sets the state of this constraint graph to top 
00820         // If onlyIfNotInit=true, this is only done if the graph is currently uninitialized
00821         // Returns true if this causes the constraint graph to be modified and false otherwise.
00822         bool setToTop(bool onlyIfNotInit=false, std::string indent="");
00823         
00824         
00825         // Returns the level and constraint type of this constraint graph
00826         // noConsistencyCheck - flag indicating whether this function should explicitly check the self-consisteny of this graph (=false)
00827         //                                                      or to not bother checking self-consistency and just return the last-known value (=true)
00828         std::pair<levels, constrTypes> getLevel(bool noConsistencyCheck=false, std::string indent="");
00829         
00830         // Returns true if this graph is self-consistent and false otherwise
00831         // noConsistencyCheck - flag indicating whether this function should explicitly check the self-consisteny of this graph (=false)
00832         //                                                      or to not bother checking self-consistency and just return the last-known value (=true)
00833         bool isSelfConsistent(bool noConsistencyCheck=false, std::string indent="");
00834         
00835         // Returns true if this graph has valid constraints and is self-consistent
00836         // noConsistencyCheck - flag indicating whether this function should explicitly check the self-consisteny of this graph (=false)
00837         //                                                      or to not bother checking self-consistency and just return the last-known value (=true)
00838         bool hasConsistentConstraints(bool noConsistencyCheck=false, std::string indent="");
00839 
00840         // Returns true if this constraint graph is maximal in that it can never reach a higher lattice state: it is
00841         //    either top or inconsistent). Returns false if it not maximal.
00842         // noConsistencyCheck - flag indicating whether this function should explicitly check the self-consisteny of this graph (=false)
00843         //                                                      or to not bother checking self-consistency and just return the last-known value (=true)
00844         bool isMaximalState(bool noConsistencyCheck=false, std::string indent="");
00845         
00846         /**** String Output *****/
00847         
00848         // Returns the string representation of the constraints held by this constraint graph, 
00849         //    with a line for each pair of variables for which the constraint is < bottom. It also prints
00850         //    the names of all the arrays that have empty ranges in this constraint graph
00851         // There is no \n on the last line of output, even if it is a multi-line string
00852         std::string str(std::string indent="");
00853         void varSetStatusToStream(const std::set<varID>& vars, std::ostringstream& outs, bool &needEndl, std::string indent="");
00854         
00855 //protected:
00856         // Returns the string representation of the constraints held by this constraint graph, 
00857         //    with a line for each pair of variables for which the constraint is < bottom. It also prints
00858         //    the names of all the arrays that have empty ranges in this constraint graph
00859         // There is no \n on the last line of output, even if it is a multi-line string
00860         // If useIsBottom=true, isBottom() is used to determine whether the graph is =bottom.
00861         // Otherwise, the bottom variable is checked.
00862         // If useIsBottom=true, isBottom() is used to determine whether the graph is =bottom.
00863         // Otherwise, the bottom variable is checked.
00864         std::string str(std::string indent, bool useIsBottom);

00867         // that has the given name
00868         std::string toDOT(std::string graphName);

00871         // that has the given name, focusing the graph on just the variables inside focusVars.

00874 public:
00875         /**** Comparison Functions ****/        
00876         bool operator != (ConstrGraph &that);
00877         bool operator == (ConstrGraph &that);
00878         bool operator == (Lattice* that);
00879         bool operator <<= (ConstrGraph &that);
00880 
00881         
00882         // Returns true if x*b+c MUST be outside the range of y and false otherwise. 
00883         // If two variables are unrelated, it is assumed that there is no information 
00884         // about their relationship and mustOutsideRange() thus proceeds conservatively (returns true).
00885         bool mustOutsideRange(varID x, int b, int c, varID y, std::string indent="");
00886         
00887         // returns true if this logical condition must be true and false otherwise
00888         // <from LogicalCond>
00889         bool mayTrue(std::string indent="");
00890         bool mayTrue() { return mayTrue(""); }
